agenda_items.title: Minutes Consideration for the minutes of April 9th, 2025 meeting.
agenda_items.summary: The minutes from the April 9th, 2025 meeting were presented for consideration and approval.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian abstained from voting, citing his absence from the April 9th meeting.

agenda_items.title: Oral Communications
agenda_items.summary: The chair noted no cards or calls for oral communication.

agenda_items.title: Recruitment and Examination Report
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented the regular recruitment and examination status report, detailing current recruitments in process and the team's ongoing work. The team has 46 open recruitments. The report identified the division of work and pinpointed the various stages of the examination and selection process. The report was for notation and file unless there were questions.

agenda_items.title: Eligible List Established
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented the regular report including all of the eligible lists that were recently established since the last meeting in April. The report included the total number of applications and the number of individuals that advanced through the various stages of the examination process.  There was a total of 13 lists that were established. Six were open to the public, five were given on a promotional basis, and two were given on an open and promotional basis. This is also a note and file item. Ms. Adams also stands ready to answer questions.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian inquired about the potential impact of a hiring freeze on these lists, if one were to occur.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Ms. Adams
commissioner_comments.comment: Ms. Adams clarified that selection processes already approved would proceed to completion. For others, the lists remain valid for two years, allowing for use if the freeze lifts. Otherwise, the process restarts upon the freeze's expiration.

agenda_items.title: Informational Report on Performance Evaluations and Return Status for City of Glendale Employees
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented the informational report on performance evaluations and return status for City of Glendale employees. The response rate is very good and there are no evaluations on the second notice list. Ms. Adams can answer any questions.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian commended the staff for achieving zero pending performance evaluations.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian expressed sincere gratitude to Commissioner Gazarian for his service and commitment to the Civil Service Commission, highlighting his inspirational role, presence, and dedication to the City of Glendale.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Ms. Adams
commissioner_comments.comment: On behalf of the Human Resources Department, Ms. Adams expressed sincere appreciation to Commissioner Gazarian for his 14 years of dedicated service to the Civil Service Commission, praising his thoughtfulness, deliberative approach, steady presence, fairness, and the way he encouraged insightful questioning, benefiting the HR team and its work. She also highlighted his guidance, impact on the HR department and assistance navigating change and challenges over the past two and a half years. Ms. Adams said it had been a pleasure to work alongside him. Ms. Adams then called forward City Manager Roubik Golanian.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Roubik Golanian
commissioner_comments.comment: Roubik Golanian conveyed his hope that this moment would not arrive, emphasizing the importance of Commissioner Gazarian's contributions. He echoed the sentiments of Chair Hatamian and Chief Human Resources Officer Adams, also speaking on behalf of the City Council, the executive team, Public Safety Department heads, and the entire City of Glendale organization.  Mr. Golanian expressed sincere appreciation for Commissioner Gazarian's 14 years of dedication to the commission, the community, and the organization as a whole.  He acknowledged challenges the Commission faced, and thanked Commissioner Gazarian for being a steady, anchoring presence that helped guide conversations and navigate processes for new Commissioners. Golanian stated that Commissioner Gazarian was a strong proponent for hiring the best and most qualified candidates, and that his public expressions of respect for City employees have not gone unnoticed. Concluding, Mr. Golanian said that Commissioner Gazarian will be missed, and wished him the best in his future endeavors.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Gazarian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Gazarian expressed being overwhelmed for multiple reasons, emphasizing his love for the City of Glendale, where he has resided for 32 years. As a staunch advocate for all things Glendale, including its Police Department, Fire Department, and all City Departments, he affirmed his belief in Glendale's transformation into a 'jewel city.' Commissioner Gazarian also stated that handling of recent fires in his area was 'something to be in awe of'.  Additionally, Gazarian acknowledged the mentorship of the late Art Devine, who served as an anchor, and recalled Sam Manoukian. Lastly, Gazarian noted he was replacing Ara Hatamian on the commission, and that Commissioner Hatamian had resigned in order to care for a child. Commissioner Gazarian thanked City Staff, in particular Russ. Commissioner Gazarian stated Paula Adams predecessor, Matt Doyle, was very close until Paula came along. He did have to adjust, but ultimately cherishes her relationship on the dias. Commissioner Gazarian told the fellow commissioners he hopes that they will continue to thrive and serve the City and City employees. Gazarian thanked attorneys Nate Kowalski and Lucy Varbedian for guiding them at closed hearings, as well as other matters. Commissioner Gazarian also thank Paula Adams for renomination. Finally, Commisioner Gazarian noted that in his zeal to serve the city, he pushed the envelope. However, he left the commission enriched by the experience. Commissioner Gazarian stated he will live in Glendale, and will serve at pleasure.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner McGravian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner McGravian acknowledged the passion and care Commissioner Gazarian demonstrated in his role. His love for the City and its people was evident, and his institutional knowledge will be greatly missed. The Commissioner appreciated his duties as Chair and being able to agree and disagree with him. His service will be missed. Commissioner McGravian also greatly appreciates the beautiful words from the public.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Reen
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Reen observed that while his time with Commissioner Gazarian was relatively brief, he quickly recognized Commissioner Gazarian's deep knowledge and practicality. He expressed that Commissioner Gazarian had served as an inspiration, setting an example of wisdom and commitment that he hopes to emulate.
